div.p: My first name is Gina and my job title is Administrative Officer. It’s quite varied really, I’m front of house so I’m sat on reception a lot of the time;
it’s on a rotational basis so you’re dealing with people coming in with different queries, old people and young people because obviously
I work within a service that helps a lot of young people that are perhaps struggling or are not really sure what they want to do and you’re
the first point of contact so you advise them the best you can; if you can’t help them then you go to someone else that can or refer them through.
There’s staff and colleagues that come into the branch that might want to see somebody or need to be shown into a meeting room for a meeting
I show them in, put the coffee machine on. On actual admin tasks it’s more sort of payroll, paying invoices, booking training,
arranging meetings, phoning round, writing up letters, sending them out, sending round emails, updating systems, updating phone lists
there’s quite a lot to it, it’s quite varied really
